name: loosestrife
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
one of a number of different plants, some with tall purple or yellow flowers, that grow wild and in gardens. Some types cause problems in areas where they do not grow naturally: Native flowers are being out-competed by purple loosestrife. One good thing about loosestrife is they attract butterflies.
More examplesFewer examplesTo kill purple loosestrife, the state raises hundreds of thousands of loosestrife-eating beetles.A single loosestrife plant can release up to one million seeds.Purple loosestrife covers about 400,000 acres in the United States.
